title: How does a shower convert hard water into soft water? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can’t. Water is usually softened in the home by an ion-exchange system which uses salt (sodium chloride) to replace the magnesium and calcium ions in hard water with sodoum ions. The water softener is quite a large device (can take up to 25 kg of salt) so to have a mini-system somehow linked to a shower head simply would not work.
It doesn't happen like that! Showers don’t change water in any way except from in a pipe to in a spray in the air. Only a water softener can change hard water to soft water.
